name: Stowaway
description: A galactic manhunt for a parasitic entity who has already blazed a trail of destruction only becomes more difficult when other parasites take on new hosts to hide their ally. Can you separate friend from foe when anyone can be harboring a killer?
rules:
-- There are two Phases to this Event! Each Phase is individually timed.
-- In this Hybrid Event, you will complete Voyages in one phase, and Supply Missions in another phase.
-- In the Voyage Phase, you will engage in Voyages with ocassional Voyage Encounters that will test proficiencies of your voyage crew.
-- Voyage Encounters take place at the following points in time: 1 minute, 5 minutes, 15 minutes, 30 minutes, 45 minutes, 1 hour, 1.5 hours, 2 hours, and every 2 hours after that.
-- Passing a Voyage Encounter without losing any contests raises the multiplier for Victory Points gained in contests. Losing a contest resets this multiplier.
-- Three of the following traits are randomly chosen for each contest: Inspiring, Explorer, Scoundrel, Casual, Playful, Hero, Marksman, Investigator. Using crew with matching traits increases their Crit Chance for the contest.
-- Using Henoch Spock, any version of O'Brien, Buckley, Kes, or Compromised crew will provide a bonus to antimatter and a permanent multiplier to passively gained Victory Points during the Voyage Phase, as well as bonus to Supply Missions during the Galaxy Phase.
-- Using the Borg Cube, the Arctic One, or the Klingon K'Vort Bird-of-Prey will provide a bonus to antimatter during the Voyage Phase.
-- Using ships with the Borg trait will provide a bonus to antimatter during the Voyage Phase.
-- In the Voyage Phase you earn Event Victory Points passively by running a voyage, and actively by winning contests during Voyage Encounters. The amount you earn increases with every Voyage Encounter passed. 
-- In the Galaxy Phase every Supply Mission you complete earns you Event Victory Points. 
-- Collect Event Victory Points to unlock Threshold Rewards!
-- Community Rewards are also available during Phase 2 only. Collect Event Victory Points to unlock these rewards before the phase change!
-- In this event, Squadrons may also compete to advance up the Squadron leaderboards. Join a Squadron to get more rewards!
bonus_text: Bonus: Henoch Spock, O'Brien, Buckley, Kes, or Compromised

featured_crew.name: Seven
featured_crew.flavor: Seven manifests the personalities of assimilated individuals. One of them - the Klingon son of K’vok - emerges as she works with Torres.

featured_crew.name: Buckley
featured_crew.flavor: The alien protecting Oriana that has been infected by Gorn eggs, which hatch and lead to a violent confrontation.

rewards.name: Chronitons
rewards.flavor: Chronitons allow your crew to take action in these chaotic times. Use Chronitons to replay parts of past missions via the Timeline.

action.name: This Isn't The Only Life Available

rewards.name: Training
rewards.flavor: Increases crew XP by 2500.

rewards.name: Chronitons
rewards.flavor: Chronitons allow your crew to take action in these chaotic times. Use Chronitons to replay parts of past missions via the Timeline.

rewards.name: Credits
rewards.flavor: Credits are the galaxy's standard currency. Use Credits in the Time Portal to enlist crew members, build items, and more.

rewards.name: B. Shuttle
rewards.flavor: 10 Basic Boosts. Go to Time Portal to collect!

ship.name: Klingon K'Vort Bird-of-Prey
ship.flavor: A versatile craft often used for scouting and patrolling. The K'Vort-class is the most stable iteration of this design.

rewards.name: ISM
rewards.flavor: ISM, or interstellar medium, is the matter that exists between astronomical objects. It can be manipulated by the Q to facilitate crew retrieval. ISM can be obtained from Daily Log-in Rewards, Campaigns and participating in Fleet activities.

rewards.name: Merits
rewards.flavor: Merits can be earned by completing missions. Use Merits to acquire faction-based rewards, upgrades to your ship, and more.

rewards.name: Training
rewards.flavor: Increases crew XP by 2500.

rewards.name: Seven
rewards.flavor: Seven manifests the personalities of assimilated individuals. One of them - the Klingon son of K’vok - emerges as she works with Torres.

rewards.name: Rarity
rewards.flavor: Contains ONE of the following 5 Polestars: Common, Uncommon, Rare, Super rare, Legendary

rewards.name: ISM
rewards.flavor: ISM, or interstellar medium, is the matter that exists between astronomical objects. It can be manipulated by the Q to facilitate crew retrieval. ISM can be obtained from Daily Log-in Rewards, Campaigns and participating in Fleet activities.

rewards.name: Dilithium
rewards.flavor: Dilithium is your most valuable asset. Use Dilithium in the Time Portal to acquire valuable crew members, items, and more.

rewards.name: Buckley
rewards.flavor: The alien protecting Oriana that has been infected by Gorn eggs, which hatch and lead to a violent confrontation.

rewards.name: 10x Portal
rewards.flavor: 10 valuable items. Go to Time Portal to collect!

screens.text: "Captain, there has been a major security breach at the Daystrom Institute. Data on a variety of experiments has been stolen, but so has a colony of parasites researchers were investigating after they used their hosts to overthrow a planet's government."
"What's the matter, drone? Is Starfleet afraid of a few insects? Or is it the idea that they may not know who they can trust at any given time?"
"These creatures are rather clever for being so small. Clever and useful. I would warn Starfleet not to get too comfortable, Captain. We are everywhere. And we will not surrender."

"Captain, we must find the parasite and its host who broke into Daystrom. Hopefully we can recapture them and the other parasites before they meet up; with Tieran and the others. I implore you to use discretion in who you trust. They could be anywhere - or anyone."
